Summary: Biochemical reaction from caffeine to 1,3,7-trimethyluric acid. This interaction is catalyzed by CYPs.
Biochemical reaction from caffeine to theophylline. This interaction is catalyzed by CYPs.
Biochemical reaction from 1,7-dimethylxanthine to 5-acetylamino-6-formylamino-3-methyluracil. This interaction is catalyzed by NAT2.
Biochemical reaction from 1-methylxanthine to 1-methyluric acid. This interaction is catalyzed by XDH.
Biochemical reaction from theophylline to 1-methylxanthine. This interaction can be catalyzed by CYP3A4 or CYP1A2.
Biochemical reaction from caffeine to theobromine. This interaction can be catalyzed by CYP2E1 or CYP1A2.
Biochemical reaction from 1,7-dimethylxanthine to 1,7-dimethyluric acid. This interaction can be catalyzed by CYP1A2 or CYP2A6.
Biochemical reaction from caffeine to 1,7-dimethylxanthine. This interaction is catalyzed by CYP1A2.
